api_context: AI Knowledge API - a document retrieval and knowledge management system

tools.name: list_collections
tools.original_definition: ToolDefinition(name='list_collections', parameters_json_schema={'type': 'object', 'properties': {'lastIndexRun': {'type': 'string', 'description': 'Flag to return the last index run of each collection.'}, 'nextIndexRun': {'type': 'string', 'description': 'Flag to return the next scheduled index run of each collection.'}, 'collectionId': {'type': 'string', 'description': "Collection ID(s) to filter by. This is a 'contains' filter - supports multiple values with OR logic."}, 'description': {'type': 'string', 'description': "Description(s) to filter by. This is a 'contains' filter - supports multiple values with OR logic."}, 'public': {'type': 'string', 'description': 'Flag to filter by public collections.'}, 'accessDenied': {'type': 'array', 'description': 'Access denied flag(s) to filter by. Supports multiple values with OR logic. Default is [False] showing only sources with access allowed.', 'default': [False], 'items': {'type': 'boolean'}}, 'businessDepartment': {'type': 'string', 'description': 'Business department(s) to filter by. Format is only the business departments number e.g. "gb80"->"80".Supports multiple values with OR logic (exact match).'}, 'projectNumber': {'type': 'string', 'description': "Project number(s) to filter by. A project number is a five digit number with the first two numbers defining the business department e.g. '80xxx'. This is a 'contains' filter - supports multiple values with OR logic."}, 'limit': {'type': 'string', 'description': 'Limit the number of collections to return.', 'default': 1000}, 'nextToken': {'type': 'string', 'description': 'Token for pagination.'}}, 'required': [], 'additionalProperties': False}, description='List all collections sorted by collectionId.')
tools.new_description: Retrieve a list of collections available in the system, optionally filtered by criteria such as collection ID, description, public visibility, business department, project number, or access status. This tool returns collections sorted by their identifiers and supports pagination and limiting the number of results. Use this to explore existing collections, find specific ones based on attributes, or obtain metadata like their last or next scheduled indexing runs as part of managing or querying collections.

tools.new_description: Create a new collection configuration to organize and manage a set of data sources. Use this tool when you need to establish a collection with a unique identifier, optionally providing a description, associating it with project numbers for cost allocation, and linking relevant data sources. You can specify the type of vector database to use, configure embedding and indexing options, enable or disable file uploads, and add plugins for additional processing features like document summarization. This tool is the starting point for setting up a collection before indexing and querying documents within it.

tools.name: get_collection_configuration
tools.original_definition: ToolDefinition(name='get_collection_configuration', parameters_json_schema={'type': 'object', 'properties': {'collection_id': {'type': 'string', 'description': ''}}, 'required': ['collection_id'], 'additionalProperties': False}, description='Get the configuration for the specified collection.')
tools.new_description: Retrieve the detailed configuration settings of a specific collection by providing its unique collection ID. Use this tool when you need to view or verify the current setup, including metadata, indexing parameters, and other configuration details of a collection within the system. This helps in understanding how a collection is structured and managed before performing updates or analysis.

tools.new_description: Update the configuration of an existing collection. Use this tool when you need to modify details such as the collection's unique identifier, description, associated project number, linked data sources, metadata, public accessibility, collection type and its database configuration, plugins for additional processing, scheduling triggers, chunking settings, embedding models, search index parameters, and file upload permissions. This operation allows you to keep the collection's setup current and aligned with your data management and indexing requirements.

tools.name: delete_collection
tools.original_definition: ToolDefinition(name='delete_collection', parameters_json_schema={'type': 'object', 'properties': {'collection_id': {'type': 'string', 'description': ''}}, 'required': ['collection_id'], 'additionalProperties': False}, description='Delete a collection.')
tools.new_description: Delete an existing collection by specifying its unique collection ID. Use this tool when you need to permanently remove a collection and all its associated data from the system. This action is typically performed when a collection is no longer needed or to free up resources.

tools.name: index_collection
tools.original_definition: ToolDefinition(name='index_collection', parameters_json_schema={'type': 'object', 'properties': {'collection_id': {'type': 'string', 'description': ''}, 'forceRun': {'type': 'boolean', 'description': 'Force the indexing run to rerun on all documents.', 'default': False}}, 'required': ['collection_id'], 'additionalProperties': False}, description='Trigger an index run for a collection.')
tools.new_description: Trigger the indexing process for a specified collection to update or build its searchable index. Use this tool when you want to initiate or refresh the indexing of documents within a collection, ensuring that the latest content is processed and available for search. You can optionally force a full reindexing of all documents to override incremental updates. This step is essential after adding or modifying documents to keep the collection's index current and accurate.

tools.name: query
tools.original_definition: ToolDefinition(name='query', parameters_json_schema={'type': 'object', 'properties': {'collection_id': {'type': 'string', 'description': ''}, 'limit': {'type': 'integer', 'description': 'Maximum number of results to return.', 'default': 5}, 'metric': {'type': 'string', 'description': 'Similarity metric to use for the vector search.', 'enum': ['L2 distance', '(negative) inner product', 'cosine distance', 'L1 distance', 'Hamming distance', 'Jaccard distance'], 'default': 'cosine distance'}, 'documentNameContains': {'type': 'string', 'description': 'Filter for documents whose names contain any of the provided strings (case-insensitive).'}, 'text': {'type': 'string', 'title': 'Text', 'description': 'Text to query against the collection.'}}, 'required': ['collection_id', 'text'], 'additionalProperties': False}, description='Query a collection.')
tools.new_description: Use this tool to perform a semantic search by querying a specific collection with a text input. It returns the most relevant documents or fragments based on the similarity between the query text and the collection's indexed content. You can specify the maximum number of results to retrieve, choose the similarity metric for the vector search, and optionally filter results to documents whose names contain certain strings. This tool is ideal when you want to find information related to a text query within a particular collection.

tools.name: get_fragment_counts
tools.original_definition: ToolDefinition(name='get_fragment_counts', parameters_json_schema={'type': 'object', 'properties': {'collection_id': {'type': 'string', 'description': ''}}, 'required': ['collection_id'], 'additionalProperties': False}, description='Get information about the number of fragments in a collection.')
tools.new_description: Retrieve detailed information about the number of fragments within a specified collection. Use this tool when you need to understand the fragment distribution or count in a collection, which can help assess the collection's content granularity and indexing status. It fits into workflows involving document analysis, indexing progress monitoring, or content management within collections.

tools.name: get_collection_usage
tools.original_definition: ToolDefinition(name='get_collection_usage', parameters_json_schema={'type': 'object', 'properties': {'collection_id': {'type': 'string', 'description': ''}, 'startDate': {'type': 'string', 'description': 'Start date for the usage data (inclusive). If not provided, defaults to the first day of the current month.'}, 'endDate': {'type': 'string', 'description': "End date for the usage data (inclusive). If not provided, defaults to today's date."}}, 'required': ['collection_id'], 'additionalProperties': False}, description='Get information about the usage of a collection.')
tools.new_description: Retrieve detailed usage information for a specific collection over a defined date range. Use this tool when you need to monitor or analyze how a collection is being utilized, such as tracking activity or resource consumption. If no start or end dates are provided, it defaults to usage data from the first day of the current month up to today. This fits into the broader workflow by helping you assess collection performance and manage resources effectively.

tools.name: get_collection_costs

Use this tool to monitor and analyze the cost incurred by a collection, with the option to include detailed daily token usage records. This step is essential when adding or updating website sources to confirm that the system can successfully retrieve data from them.

tools.name: info
tools.original_definition: ToolDefinition(name='info', parameters_json_schema={'type': 'object', 'properties': {}, 'required': [], 'additionalProperties': False}, description='Information about the API.')
tools.new_description: Retrieve general information about the API, including its capabilities and status. Use this tool when you need an overview or metadata about the API to understand its features or confirm its availability. It serves as a starting point for exploring the API's functionality.

tools.name: available_models
tools.original_definition: ToolDefinition(name='available_models', parameters_json_schema={'type': 'object', 'properties': {'modelType': {'type': 'string', 'description': "Filter models by type (e.g., 'text-completion', 'text-embedding', 'multimodal-completion)."}, 'provider': {'type': 'string', 'description': "Filter models by provider (e.g., 'azure', 'openai', 'cohere', 'bedrock')."}}, 'required': [], 'additionalProperties': False}, description='Get available LLM and embedding models.')
tools.new_description: Retrieve a list of available language and embedding models that can be used for tasks such as text completion, embedding generation, or multimodal completion. You can optionally filter the models by their type (e.g., text-completion, text-embedding) or by their provider (e.g., azure, openai, cohere, bedrock). Use this tool when you need to discover which models are accessible for your operations or to select an appropriate model for a specific task within the API workflow.

tools.name: delete_document
tools.original_definition: ToolDefinition(name='delete_document', parameters_json_schema={'type': 'object', 'properties': {'collection_id': {'type': 'string', 'description': ''}, 'filename': {'type': 'string', 'description': ''}}, 'required': ['collection_id', 'filename'], 'additionalProperties': False}, description='Delete a document from a collection, which was manually uploaded.')
tools.new_description: Delete a manually uploaded document from a specified collection. Use this tool when you need to remove a specific document file from the collection's storage, typically to manage or clean up uploaded content. Provide the collection identifier and the filename of the document to be deleted.

tools.name: get_presigned_url
tools.original_definition: ToolDefinition(name='get_presigned_url', parameters_json_schema={'type': 'object', 'properties': {'collection_id': {'type': 'string', 'description': ''}, 'filename': {'type': 'string', 'description': ''}}, 'required': ['collection_id', 'filename'], 'additionalProperties': False}, description='Get a presigned URL for uploading a document to a collection')
tools.new_description: Generate a presigned URL that allows uploading a document to a specified collection. Use this tool when you need a secure, time-limited URL to upload a file directly to the collection's storage without handling the upload process yourself. This fits into the workflow of adding new documents to a collection by first obtaining the upload URL before transferring the document data.

tools.new_description: Retrieve a list of documents that have been indexed within a specified collection. Use this tool when you need to view or manage the documents currently indexed, optionally filtering by document ID or partial document name, and controlling the number of results returned. It supports pagination to handle large sets of documents. This is useful for monitoring and interacting with the indexed content in your collections.

tools.name: get_document_uploaded
tools.original_definition: ToolDefinition(name='get_document_uploaded', parameters_json_schema={'type': 'object', 'properties': {'collection_id': {'type': 'string', 'description': ''}, 'limit': {'type': 'string', 'description': 'Limit the number of documents to return.', 'default': 1000}, 'nextToken': {'type': 'string', 'description': 'Token for pagination.'}, 'documentId': {'type': 'string', 'description': 'ID of the document to filter by (sort key - single value only). This will take precedence over other filters.'}, 'documentNameContains': {'type': 'string', 'description': "Name of the documents to filter by. Supports multiple values with OR logic. The filter is case-sensitive and supports partial matches using the 'contains' operator."}}, 'required': ['collection_id'], 'additionalProperties': False}, description='List manually uploaded documents in a collection')
tools.new_description: Retrieve a list of documents that have been manually uploaded to a specified collection. Use this tool when you need to view or manage documents added directly by users rather than those indexed automatically. It supports filtering by document ID or partial document name and allows pagination to handle large sets of uploaded documents. This fits into workflows where you want to review, verify, or operate on user-uploaded content within a collection.

tools.name: get_document_content
tools.original_definition: ToolDefinition(name='get_document_content', parameters_json_schema={'type': 'object', 'properties': {'collection_id': {'type': 'string', 'description': ''}, 'document_id': {'type': 'string', 'description': ''}, 'limit': {'type': 'integer', 'description': 'Limit the number of characters to return. 0 returns all content.', 'default': 0, 'minimum': 0}, 'nextToken': {'type': 'integer', 'description': 'Character offset for pagination.', 'default': 0, 'minimum': 0}}, 'required': ['collection_id', 'document_id'], 'additionalProperties': False}, description='Get the content of a document in a collection')
tools.new_description: Retrieve the textual content of a specific document within a collection. Use this tool when you need to access the full or partial content of a document, optionally limiting the number of characters returned or paginating through the content by specifying an offset. This is useful for reviewing document details or processing document text in manageable segments as part of your workflow with collections and their documents.

tools.name: get_document_fragments
tools.original_definition: ToolDefinition(name='get_document_fragments', parameters_json_schema={'type': 'object', 'properties': {'collection_id': {'type': 'string', 'description': ''}, 'document_id': {'type': 'string', 'description': ''}, 'limit': {'type': 'string', 'description': 'Limit the number of fragments to return.', 'default': 1000}, 'nextToken': {'type': 'string', 'description': 'Token for pagination (offset-based).'}}, 'required': ['collection_id', 'document_id'], 'additionalProperties': False}, description='Get the fragments of a document in a collection')
tools.new_description: Retrieve the individual fragments or segments of a specific document within a collection. Use this tool when you need to access or analyze smaller parts of a document rather than the entire content at once. It supports pagination to handle large documents by limiting the number of fragments returned per request. This is useful for detailed inspection, processing, or incremental reading of document content within the broader workflow of managing and querying documents in collections.

tools.name: get_index_runs
tools.original_definition: ToolDefinition(name='get_index_runs', parameters_json_schema={'type': 'object', 'properties': {'collection_id': {'type': 'string', 'description': ''}, 'taskStatus': {'type': 'string', 'description': 'Task status(es) - supports multiple values'}, 'nextToken': {'type': 'string', 'description': 'Next token for pagination'}, 'limit': {'type': 'string', 'description': 'Limit for pagination'}}, 'required': ['collection_id'], 'additionalProperties': False}, description='List index runs in a collection')
tools.new_description: Retrieve a list of indexing runs performed on a specific collection. Use this tool when you want to review the history or status of indexing operations for that collection, including filtering by task status or controlling pagination and result limits. This helps monitor and manage the indexing workflow within the collection lifecycle.

tools.name: get_index_run
tools.original_definition: ToolDefinition(name='get_index_run', parameters_json_schema={'type': 'object', 'properties': {'collection_id': {'type': 'string', 'description': ''}, 'index_run_id': {'type': 'string', 'description': ''}}, 'required': ['collection_id', 'index_run_id'], 'additionalProperties': False}, description='Get details of a specific index run in a collection')
tools.new_description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific indexing run within a collection. Use this tool when you need to examine the status, results, or metadata of a particular index run to monitor progress, troubleshoot issues, or review indexing outcomes as part of managing and maintaining your collection's data indexing workflow.

tools.name: get_index_run_tasks
tools.original_definition: ToolDefinition(name='get_index_run_tasks', parameters_json_schema={'type': 'object', 'properties': {'collection_id': {'type': 'string', 'description': ''}, 'index_run_id': {'type': 'string', 'description': ''}, 'taskStatus': {'type': 'string', 'description': 'Task status(es) - supports multiple values'}, 'nextToken': {'type': 'string', 'description': 'Next token for pagination'}, 'limit': {'type': 'string', 'description': 'Limit for pagination'}, 'task': {'type': 'string', 'description': 'Task type(s) - supports multiple values'}, 'datetimeExecution': {'type': 'string', 'description': 'ISO datetime of when the run was executed'}, 'sourceId': {'type': 'string', 'description': 'ID(s) of the source - supports multiple values'}, 'documentId': {'type': 'string', 'description': 'ID(s) of the document - supports multiple values'}}, 'required': ['collection_id', 'index_run_id'], 'additionalProperties': False}, description='List tasks of an index runs in a collection')
tools.new_description: Retrieve detailed information about the individual tasks associated with a specific index run within a collection. Use this tool when you need to monitor, filter, or analyze the progress and status of various tasks performed during an indexing operation, such as by task type, status, execution time, source, or document. It helps you gain insight into the components of an index run, supporting pagination and filtering to manage large sets of tasks effectively within the broader indexing workflow.

tools.name: get_index_run_progress
tools.original_definition: ToolDefinition(name='get_index_run_progress', parameters_json_schema={'type': 'object', 'properties': {'collection_id': {'type': 'string', 'description': ''}, 'index_run_id': {'type': 'string', 'description': ''}}, 'required': ['collection_id', 'index_run_id'], 'additionalProperties': False}, description='Get progress of an active index run in a collection')
tools.new_description: Retrieve the current progress details of an ongoing indexing run within a specified collection. Use this tool when you need to monitor how far an active index run has advanced, helping you track indexing status and completion in real time as part of managing and maintaining collection data.

tools.name: get_index_run_costs
tools.original_definition: ToolDefinition(name='get_index_run_costs', parameters_json_schema={'type': 'object', 'properties': {'collection_id': {'type': 'string', 'description': ''}, 'index_run_id': {'type': 'string', 'description': ''}, 'showDetails': {'type': 'boolean', 'description': 'Whether to include detailed usage records in the response', 'default': False}}, 'required': ['collection_id', 'index_run_id'], 'additionalProperties': False}, description='Get token usage and associated costs of an index run in a collection')
tools.new_description: Retrieve detailed information about the token usage and associated costs for a specific index run within a collection. Use this tool when you need to analyze the resource consumption and expenses related to a particular indexing operation. Optionally, you can request detailed usage records to gain deeper insights into the cost breakdown for that index run. This fits into the workflow of monitoring and managing indexing efficiency and cost control for collections.

tools.name: get_permissions
tools.original_definition:
ToolDefinition(name='get_permissions', parameters_json_schema={'type': 'object', 'properties': {'resource_type': {'type': 'string', 'description': ''}, 'resource_name': {'type': 'string', 'description': 'Name of the resource'}}, 'required': ['resource_type', 'resource_name'], 'additionalProperties': False}, description='Retrieve all user-manageable permissions associated with a resource.

This API provides a list of roles defined for the given resource, where
each role includes the users associated with it and the set of
permissions they are granted.  The permissions returned are limited to
those that users can manage directly.

Args:
    resource_type (str):
        The type or category of the resource (e.g., "document",
        "project").
    request (ResourceRequest):
        The request object containing the resource name for which
        permissions are requested.
    userauth (UserAuthorization):
        The user authorization object for permission checking.

Returns:
    list[RoleData]: A list of roles for the resource; each role includes
    the role name, list of member users, and list of permissions with
    their granted status.

Raises:
    HTTPException: 404
        if the resource type is not defined or if the permissions for
        the resource do not exist.')
tools.new_description: Retrieve the list of roles and their associated user-manageable permissions for a specified resource. Use this tool when you need to understand which roles exist for a resource, which users belong to each role, and what permissions each role currently has. This helps in managing access control and auditing permissions within the broader workflow of resource management. Provide the resource type and resource name to get a detailed overview of roles and their granted permissions.

tools.name: add_role
tools.original_definition:
ToolDefinition(name='add_role', parameters_json_schema={'type': 'object', 'properties': {'resource_type': {'type': 'string', 'description': ''}, 'resource_name': {'type': 'string', 'title': 'Resource Name', 'description': 'Name of the resource'}, 'role': {'type': 'string', 'title': 'Role', 'description': 'Name of the role to update'}}, 'required': ['resource_type', 'resource_name', 'role'], 'additionalProperties': False}, description="Add a new role to a specified resource.

This function creates a new role associated with a given resource type
and resource name. The new role is initialized without any users or
permissions assigned, except for the default permissions specified in
the model's new_role_permissions.

Args:
    resource_type (str):
        The type/category of the resource to which the role will be
        added.
    request (RoleRequest):
        The request object containing the resource name and role name.
    userauth (UserAuthorization):
        The user authorization object for permission checking.

Raises:
    HTTPException: 404
        if the resource type is not defined or the resource permissions
        do not exist.
    HTTPException: 422
        if a role with the specified name already exists for the
        resource.")
tools.new_description: Create a new role for a specified resource by providing the resource type, resource name, and the desired role name. This tool initializes the role without any users or custom permissions, applying only the system's default permissions for new roles. Use this when you need to define additional roles to manage access or responsibilities within a particular resource context.

tools.name: remove_role
tools.original_definition:
ToolDefinition(name='remove_role', parameters_json_schema={'type': 'object', 'properties': {'resource_type': {'type': 'string', 'description': ''}, 'resource_name': {'type': 'string', 'title': 'Resource Name', 'description': 'Name of the resource'}, 'role': {'type': 'string', 'title': 'Role', 'description': 'Name of the role to update'}}, 'required': ['resource_type', 'resource_name', 'role'], 'additionalProperties': False}, description='Remove a role from a specified resource.

This function removes the given role from the identified resource type
and resource name. Note that the owner role is protected and cannot be
removed; attempting to do so will result in an HTTP 422 error.

Args:
    resource_type (str):
        The type/category of the resource from which the role will be
        removed.
    request (RoleRequest):
        The request object containing the resource name and role name.
    userauth (UserAuthorization):
        The user authorization object for permission checking.

Raises:
    HTTPException: 404
        if the resource type is not defined, the resource permissions do
        not exist, or the role does not exist.
    HTTPException: 422
        if an attempt is made to remove the owner role, which is not
        permitted.')
tools.new_description: Remove a specified role from a given resource. Use this tool when you need to delete a role associated with a particular resource type and resource name. Note that the owner role is protected and cannot be removed; attempts to remove it will fail. This operation helps manage and update the roles available for controlling access and permissions on resources within the system.

tools.name: grant_permission
tools.original_definition:
ToolDefinition(name='grant_permission', parameters_json_schema={'type': 'object', 'properties': {'resource_type': {'type': 'string', 'description': ''}, 'resource_name': {'type': 'string', 'title': 'Resource Name', 'description': 'Name of the resource'}, 'role': {'type': 'string', 'title': 'Role', 'description': 'Name of the role to update'}, 'permission': {'type': 'string', 'title': 'Permission', 'description': 'ID of the permission to add or remove'}}, 'required': ['resource_type', 'resource_name', 'role', 'permission'], 'additionalProperties': False}, description='Grant a specific permission to a role on a given resource.

This function grants a permission identified by its scope name to a
specified role, on a particular resource type and resource name.

Args:
    resource_type (str):
        The type/category of the resource to which the permission
        applies.
    request (PermissionRoleRequest):
        The request containing the resource name, role name, and
        permission ID to be granted.
    userauth (UserAuthorization):
        The user authorization object for permission checking.

Raises:
    HTTPException: 404 if the resource permissions do not exist or the
        role does not exist.
    HTTPException: 422 if the permission is not defined, not
        user-manageable, or is already granted to the role.')
tools.new_description: Use this tool to grant a specific permission to a designated role for a particular resource. It allows you to assign a defined permission to a role within the context of a given resource type and resource name. This is useful when you need to update access controls or capabilities by adding new permissions to roles as part of managing resource security and access policies.

tools.name: revoke_permission
tools.original_definition:
ToolDefinition(name='revoke_permission', parameters_json_schema={'type': 'object', 'properties': {'resource_type': {'type': 'string', 'description': ''}, 'resource_name': {'type': 'string', 'title': 'Resource Name', 'description': 'Name of the resource'}, 'role': {'type': 'string', 'title': 'Role', 'description': 'Name of the role to update'}, 'permission': {'type': 'string', 'title': 'Permission', 'description': 'ID of the permission to add or remove'}}, 'required': ['resource_type', 'resource_name', 'role', 'permission'], 'additionalProperties': False}, description='Revoke a specific permission from a role on given resource.

This function removes a previously granted permission from a role on a
particular resource type and resource name.

Args:
    resource_type (str):
        The type/category of the resource from which the permission is
        to be revoked.
    request (PermissionRoleRequest):
        The request object containing the resource name, role name, and
        permission ID to be revoked.
    userauth (UserAuthorization):
        The user authorization object for permission checking.

Raises:
    HTTPException: 404 if the resource permissions do not exist or the
        role does not exist.
    HTTPException: 422 if the permission is not defined, not
        user-manageable, or is not currently granted to the role on the
        resource.')
tools.new_description: Remove a specific permission from a role associated with a given resource. Use this tool when you need to revoke an existing permission that was previously granted to a role on a particular resource type and resource name. This helps manage and update access controls by ensuring roles only retain the permissions they should have within the system.

tools.name: add_user
tools.original_definition:
ToolDefinition(name='add_user', parameters_json_schema={'type': 'object', 'properties': {'resource_type': {'type': 'string', 'description': ''}, 'resource_name': {'type': 'string', 'title': 'Resource Name', 'description': 'Name of the resource'}, 'role': {'type': 'string', 'title': 'Role', 'description': 'Name of the role to update'}, 'user': {'type': 'string', 'title': 'User', 'description': 'Username of the user'}}, 'required': ['resource_type', 'resource_name', 'role', 'user'], 'additionalProperties': False}, description="Add a user to a specific role on a given resource.

This function associates the specified user with a role on a resource,
enabling them to access or manage that resource according to the role's
permissions.

Args:
    resource_type (str):
        The type/category of the resource (e.g., project, team,
        application).
    request (UserRoleRequest):
        The request object containing the resource name, role name, and
        username.
    userauth (UserAuthorization):
        The user authorization object for permission checking.

Raises:
    HTTPException: 422 if the user is already a member of the specified
    role on the given resource.")
tools.new_description: Assign a specified user to a particular role on a given resource. Use this tool when you need to grant a user access or management permissions for a resource by adding them to one of its roles. This operation helps manage user roles and permissions within the broader resource access control workflow.

tools.name: remove_user
tools.original_definition:
ToolDefinition(name='remove_user', parameters_json_schema={'type': 'object', 'properties': {'resource_type': {'type': 'string', 'description': ''}, 'resource_name': {'type': 'string', 'title': 'Resource Name', 'description': 'Name of the resource'}, 'role': {'type': 'string', 'title': 'Role', 'description': 'Name of the role to update'}, 'user': {'type': 'string', 'title': 'User', 'description': 'Username of the user'}}, 'required': ['resource_type', 'resource_name', 'role', 'user'], 'additionalProperties': False}, description='Remove a user from a specific role on a given resource.

This function removes the specified user from the given role on the
given resource.  The user will no longer have the permissions associated
with that role for the resource, unless they have those permissions
through another role.

Note that a user is not allowed to remove themselves from the owner role
to prevent accidental loss of ownership. Additionally, the owner role
must always have at least one member.

Args:
    resource_type (str):
        The type/category of the resource (e.g., project, repository).
    request (UserRoleRequest):
        The request object containing the resource name, role name, and
        username.
    userauth (UserAuthorization):
        The user authorization object for permission checking.

Raises:
    HTTPException: 404
        if the resource permissions do not exist or the role does not
        exist.
    HTTPException: 422
        if the user is not currently assigned to the role, if attempting
        to remove oneself from the owner role, or if attempting to
        remove the last member from the owner role.')
tools.new_description: Remove a specified user from a particular role on a given resource. Use this tool when you need to revoke a user's permissions associated with that role for the resource. It ensures that the user no longer has access through that role unless they hold other roles granting those permissions. This operation respects constraints such as preventing users from removing themselves from the owner role and ensuring the owner role always has at least one member. This tool fits into managing user access and roles within resource permission workflows.

tools.name: add_users
tools.original_definition:
ToolDefinition(name='add_users', parameters_json_schema={'type': 'object', 'properties': {'resource_type': {'type': 'string', 'description': ''}, 'resource_name': {'type': 'string', 'title': 'Resource Name', 'description': 'Name of the resource'}, 'role': {'type': 'string', 'title': 'Role', 'description': 'Name of the role to update'}, 'users': {'items': {'type': 'string'}, 'type': 'array', 'maxItems': 100, 'minItems': 1, 'title': 'Users', 'description': 'Usernames of the users'}}, 'required': ['resource_type', 'resource_name', 'role', 'users'], 'additionalProperties': False}, description="Add multiple users to a specific role on a given resource.

This function associates the specified users with a role on a resource,
enabling them to access or manage that resource according to the role's
permissions.

Args:
    resource_type (str):
        The type/category of the resource (e.g., project, team,
        application).
    request (UsersRoleRequest):
        The request object containing the resource name, role name, and
        usernames.
    userauth (UserAuthorization):
        The user authorization object for permission checking.

Notes:
    Users who are already members of the specified role will be skipped.")
tools.new_description: Add multiple users to a specified role on a given resource. Use this tool when you need to assign a group of users the same role, granting them the associated permissions to access or manage that resource. It streamlines role management by handling batch user additions, skipping any users who are already members of the role. This fits into workflows involving user and permission management across projects, teams, or applications.
